reviews.review: If theres one game you absolutly must have it should be Portal 2. Twice as better as the first in my opinion and the coop just adds more and more play time. The robots always make me laugh in the story and its just a great game. Heads up this game also requires you to use your brain! You know... Like to think... Get this game you wont be disappointed, Good Story, Good Graphics, Funny and Simply a classic.

Unbelievable has become real - I'm recommending Portal 2. After the first game I wasn't expecting much. But boy, this one surprised me! Much longer campaign with better story, interesting environment, memorable soundtrack, cute final cutscene and new, extremely likeable character called Wheatley. Cooperative campaign included makes this all even better - and is cleverly done too. I must admit this has been one of my best buys.

Best story ever! I really like it. When you think that story can't go further... it goes. And those big areas, you pretty feel like you are there, those voice-overs and characters. Absolutely amazing and I haven't even play a coop mode yet, I'm looking forward to play it with someone. Totally recomend 10/10.

[EDIT] Coop is amazing, love to play it with my friends, it's relaxing and also challenging.

Portal 2 continues where the original left off, adding more puzzles and things to play with in this fun sequal.  While it isn't as groundbreaking as the first was, I don't think anything can be.

Pros:

More of the same fun as the original
Multiplayer
User-generated conted and maps to explore

Cons:

Just didn't "wow" me as much as the original

It's hard to beat the groundbreaking Portal, and although this is a great game with a lot of Valve polish I would recommend anyone to play the first over the second in a heartbeat (unless they're playing with a friend).  B+

Very well made sequel of the game. It's a lot of fun to play, the Co-op is interesting aswell. All in all the purchase of the game is a win-win situation if you have already played Portal and liked it.

I had Portal on the PS3 and thourghly enjoyed playing it, so when this came up in the steam sale I had to buy it, and I didn't regret it. The astetics are amazing and really do justice to the game, and the characters are easy to connect with, with some nice twists and turns. Really good game

For the second installment of the Portal series this game really did deliver! How the story fleshed out the Aperture history by allowing you to travel back in time, if you will, and play the early testing levels of the Aperture labs, which by the way were huge! Not only that but having the narration of Cave Johnson follow you through as a test subject who was classified as really no more than a bum off the street. I found this quite humorous. Then later in the game as you are carrying around Gla-DOS powered by a potato while you are battling your wits against Wheatley's devious test chambers was an excellent trade off from the first game where there was only Gla-DOS as your nemesis. So even at the end of the game where you wind up in a wheat field after being portaled to the moon and back really did leave me with a sense of not that I finished this game but wondering what will be the next book in the Portal saga, whenever that will grace our respective PCs.

Следует процитировать мнение сайта IGN: «Лучшая игра на PC», «Лучшая игра на Xbox 360», «Лучшая игра на PS3» и «Лучшая игра-головоломка». Подписываюсь под этим.

It's hard to follow up one of the best games of a decade, possibly of all time, with another...but they did it. Gabe Newell was a genius to hire the Portal development team on the spot when he met them.

Portal 2, need i say more?

Like portal but better! 
the parts I liked best in the first portal was actually the behind the scenes stuff(in the games universe) and the story, the puzzles themselves I actually found a little boring and what kept me going was the funny dialogue and story.

Portal 2 got much more of the stuff I liked and seems like it got a even bigger focus on the narrative with the inclusion of multiple funny personalities and even more behind the scenes stuff(both in game and as extra commentary) and the puzzles has also gotten more elaborate with the inclusion of a couple of new mechanics.

the adition of multiplayer coop is also great and makes for some fun puzzle solving.(Hi Andrew!)

A puzzle FPS that focuses heavily on the story and the story is amazing. Funny yet dramatic, the story is the only reason you'd buy this game but it's worth every penny. It can be very confusing during certain segments and there's not too much replay value for both the single player and multiplayer since you'll already know the solution to the puzzles although you may want to replay it again just for the amazing story. One of the best PC games ever.
A must play. Total brainmelter!
Since 2011, It's still enjoyable game and I could play it over and over again.  The story and concept are great.
